cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: java-1.8.0-ibm security update

full_product_name.product_name: java-1.8.0-ibm-1:1.8.0.6.35-1.el8_4 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 Supplementary

notes.note: OpenJDK: FTP PASV command response can cause FtpClient to connect to arbitrary host (Networking, 8258432)

reference.description: bz#1982874: CVE-2021-2341 OpenJDK: FTP PASV command response can cause FtpClient to connect to arbitrary host (Networking, 8258432)

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
All running instances of IBM Java must be restarted for this update to take effect.

notes.note: OpenJDK: Incorrect verification of JAR files with multiple MANIFEST.MF files (Library, 8260967)

reference.description: bz#1982879: CVE-2021-2369 OpenJDK: Incorrect verification of JAR files with multiple MANIFEST.MF files (Library, 8260967)

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
All running instances of IBM Java must be restarted for this update to take effect.

note:
An update for java-1.8.0-ibm is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

IBM Java SE version 8 includes the IBM Java Runtime Environment and the IBM Java Software Development Kit.
This update upgrades IBM Java SE 8 to version 8 SR6-FP35.
Security Fix(es):
* OpenJDK: FTP PASV command response can cause FtpClient to connect to arbitrary host (Networking, 8258432) (CVE-2021-2341)
* OpenJDK: Incorrect verification of JAR files with multiple MANIFEST.MF files (Library, 8260967) (CVE-2021-2369)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
